rules.natural: If van_01 experiences a vehicle breakdown, then the morning route is not delayed
Either van_01 experiences a vehicle breakdown or the main highway has a traffic closure
If the main highway has a traffic closure, then the morning route is not delayed
If driver John is assigned to the downtown route, then the downtown route uses van_02
Either driver John is assigned to the downtown route or driver Mary is assigned to the downtown route
Should driver Mary be assigned to the downtown route, then all routes are on schedule
When the downtown route uses van_02, then the downtown route requires a special permit
Given that the downtown route requires a special permit, then all routes are on schedule
If medical supplies have an urgent delivery requirement, then medical supplies require express shipping
When medical supplies require express shipping, then medical supplies are marked as priority
If medical supplies are marked as priority, then medical supplies use an express courier
Should the main depot have van_01 as an operational vehicle, then the main depot has van_02 as a backup vehicle
If the dispatch system is operational, then all routes are on schedule

Either the dispatch system undergoes a system update or the dispatch system undergoes system maintenance
If the dispatch system undergoes system maintenance, then the dispatch system is operational
When driver John logged 40 hours, then van_01 passes inspection
If supervisor approved driver John's timesheet, then payroll processed driver John's timesheet
When payroll processed driver John's timesheet, then if driver John submitted his timesheet, driver John logged 40 hours

Provided that it is not the case that driver John completing safety training leads to driver John having valid insurance resulting in all routes being on schedule, then the morning route is delayed
If it is not the case that van_01 not passing inspection leads to driver John not requiring retraining, then driver John is suspended from duty
